A Brief Introduction to pyFlareÂ¶

The development of pyFlare was driven by the need for an automated means to identify flaring events in lightcurves released by the Kepler mission. This has led to the modern package containing logic to perform hypothesis testing and produce detection statistics, in addition to being able to handle the large quantities of data which are available, and the additional data required to successfully run an analysis.

The statistical methods used in pyFlare owe much to data analysis developments from the field of gravitational wave research; the detection statistic which is used is based on one developed to identify ring downs in gravtitational wave detector data.

The power of this technique has increased as it was developed, and the package now contains logic capable of identifying planetary transits in the same Kepler data, and can be extended to perform searches for arbitrarily defined profiles.
